channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Driving along the A435 at Bishops Cleve, heading towards Evesham, today the 28th May at 12:09, outside a small building site, there is a large sunken drain that felt on impact, felt like a loud bang as the car hit the hole at approximately 45-50mph. The sunken drain has left quite a deep hole and I think this is not only dangerous to other motorists but also cyclists and motorcyclists, as could result in the rider coming off their bike. I attempted to avoid the sunken drain but this wasnâ€™t possible due to on coming traffic and parked builders vans straddling the pavement and the road adjacent to the sunken drain., 28th May
item.description:
The photo's attached show the sunken drain, which is just before "Stollards Close" , with Stollards Close being on the left, heading towards Evesham. I believe this would be what three words location close to the problem is "smiled.behind.banana".

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes on this stretch of road and edges of road are bad for cyclists, 28th May
item.description:
Crevices along edge of road making it very dangerous for cyclists when a car passes them and they have to move close to the verge. Numerous potholes which could damage my car! Whole road is in a mess. From Whittington to the junction to go to Cleeve Common and then down to Battledown.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large abandoned traffic cone on pavement, 28th May
item.description:
Opposite (across road from) 2 Glencairn Park Road, GL50 2NA. Large traffic cone has been on pavement for months. Either left behind from previous roadworks, or just dumped. Needs removing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Glencairn Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Zero visabilty at known crash point, 28th May
item.description:
The grass verge is higher than any average car and thus you can not see to pull put safley. This junction is a high crash area with accidents frequently.ypu can not see any traffic even lorries coming up from the direction of the A436 (frogmill pub way) to the Killkenny pub. Needs to be cut urgently
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet
